Voices of Europe (57-7)

Topic and Speakers
"The Jews of Germany" - Rabbi I. E.
Lichtigfeld, lawyer as well as clergyman,
was originally from Frankfurt, but lived
and worked in England from 1933 to 1953.
Has been a leader in Jewish activities
all these years, and head rabbi in Frank¬
furt since his return to Germany in 1953.
"Experiment in International Living" -
Herr Walther Gaupp, schoolteacher in
Lubbecke, Germany, has been vital in
the Experiment in International Living
since he joined while studying in Vermont
in the early ’30’s just before Hitler.
He continued his work during Nazism,
taking his students on tours of the U. S.
and England. Served in the German Army
and after internment in England in 1945-
46 has continued his work with the Experi¬
ment during the last decade.
"Return to Austria" - Frau Kuenehet-
Leddihn, wife of Erik von Ritter Kuenhet-
Leddihn, heard on program four of this
series. She has a Ph.D. from the Univ¬
ersity of Gratz in Austria, and while
in the U, S. from 1937-47 she played
the dual role of wife and mother and
professional worker.
